page.title: 06Anstey Fair.
page.content: Once a year, on the nearest Sunday to St. Swithun's Day, the village holds its Fair.The Fair is the highlight of the community's year and is held on the nearest Sunday to St. Swithun's Day.The money raised goes to support the Church,the school and other causes around the village.The Fair first started in the Middle Ages and was held on Cheapside.This is how Cheapside got its name.The Fair was restarted in 1978 by the Reverand Roger Tamplin. At the Fair you can play games,buy things,eat and drink,win prizes,see exhibitions and have a good time.In 1984 the Fair raised Â£1,755.
